title.narrative: CHILD & HIV-SENSITIVE SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: By 2016, strengthened institutional capacity of child protection and community support systems improve social protection, care and support for all children., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, strengthened social policy and protection systems and services reduce vulnerability, improve equity and ensure protection for all children.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN Place(Annex) Matsitama Road P O Box 20678 Gaborone

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, strengthened institutional capacity of child protection and community support systems improve social protection, care andsupport for all children.

description.narrative: In 2016, Government capacity for reporting on international human rights treaties were strengthened, 2194 children in remote areas received birth certificates through mobile registration, children shared their views on Botswana's Vision 2036 and 120 field police officers and 48 station commanders trained on juvenile justice and child-friendly processes and procedures. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2017

title.narrative: of coordination bodies in place to strengthen child protection system

actual.value: 2016:NCC and CCF in place to strengthen child protection system

title.narrative: Proportion of villages with Village Child Protection Committees established
Proportion of all children (under-5 years) registered

actual.value: 2016:Mobile birth registration campaigns in the hard to reach areas used to accelerate birth registration for disadvantaged children such as OVC.

title.narrative: Government has preventive strategies on child sexual abuse and juvenile injustice

actual.value: 2016:Children's Act 2009 used as an advocacy tool to prevent child sexual abuse and juvenile injustices. Manual on child friendly process and procedures used to train police to curb juvenile injustices

title.narrative: National Children's Council is independent and funded by government

actual.value: 2016:NCC is partially independent but is not yet fully funded by government.

title.narrative: Government ratifies the Hague convention on inter-country adoption

actual.value: 2016:No. The Hague Convention not yet ratified due to lack of consultation with stakeholders

title.narrative: Government has a national plan of action in place to address the HIV sensitive social protection needs of orphans and vulnerable children

actual.value: 2016:Yes. Botswana National Plan of Action for OVC 2010-2016 is in place and is being implemented and monitored.
